section.b: Configuration of Swift Services in the entry-scale-with-vsa
section.p: The following yml files are configured for entry-scale-with-vsa model:

li.p: This yml file contains the Swift information (swiftobj disk-group). This describes what disks on each of the servers are assigned to Swift and the rings that uses those drives.

Swift account, container, and object storage are managed by Swift using a data structure known as a ring. This yml file provides the specification of the rings. For more information on ring specification, refer to ring specification.

section.b: Configuration of Swift Services in the Mid Size Cloud Model

body.p: There are two type of nodes that is associated with Swift services. They are as follows:

ul.li: Proxy, Container, Account (PAC) Node: This node runs the Swift-proxy, Swift-account, and Swift-container services. The Swift-proxy service processes API requests and directs them to the Swift-account, Swift-container or Swift-object services for processing. The Swift-account and Swift-container handle requests to accounts and containers respectively.
Object (OBJ) Node: This node runs the Swift-object service. The Swift-object service handles requests for objects.

section.p: In the example mid sized cloud model, the Swift services are configured in the following yml files:

ul.li: The Proxy, Container, Account node type is assigned to a dedicated cluster of nodes as specified in the swpac cluster in yml file. These nodes are dedicated only to Swift services.
The Object node type is assigned to a dedicated resource nodes group as specified in the swobj group in yml file.

Request to Swift are directed to a virtual IP address (VIP) that is managed by a cluster as specified in the core cluster in data/control_plane.yml file. The requests are then directed on the MGMT network to the Swift-proxy service on one of the Proxy, Container, Account nodes.

li.p: The Proxy, Container, Account node type uses two disk drives to store account and container databases which is specified in this file.
The Object node type uses two disk drives to store account and container databases which is specified in this file.

Swift account, container, and object storage are managed by Swift using a data structure known as a ring. This yml file provides the specification of the rings. For more information on ring specification, refer to ring specification.
This yml file specifies the MGMT and Swift networks. The Swift-proxy service uses the Swift network to communicate with the other Swift services and among themselves.

Swift validates token by making requests to the Keystone service
